target_text: "OK, great. Software quality is the end result. It has a structural perspective which is the code and the design. It has also an external component which is free of defects and meets the end user requirements."

Codebook.Definition: The overall measure of how well software meets certain standards, including structural integrity and user satisfaction.
The aspect of software quality that focuses on the internal components such as code and design.
The aspect of software quality that involves the software being free of defects and meeting the requirements of the end user.
